meanings.sent1: The amicable neighbors always greet each other with smiles.
meanings.sent2: She had an amicable conversation with her colleague over lunch.
meanings.sent3: The amicable puppy wagged its tail happily at everyone it met.
meanings.sent4: The amicable atmosphere in the room made it easy for strangers to strike up conversations.
meanings.sent5: The amicable relationship between the two countries led to successful trade agreements.

meanings.definition: showing a polite and friendly desire to avoid disagreement or argument
meanings.sent1: The amicable student offered to help his classmate with the project.
meanings.sent2: Their amicable discussion resolved the issue without any conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The amicable cat purred softly as it snuggled up to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The amicable tone of the meeting set a positive mood for the negotiations.
meanings.sent5: Her amicable smile diffused the tension in the room instantly.
